author: A_Brickset_user
review: My third set after my dark age. My brother bought me as 26 th birthday gift :).This is a cool set, the V6 engine looks great, the wheels are very cool. The suspension is nice. A smaller supercar.It's great

author: A_Brickset_user
review: This was my first LARGE technic set. This set is great. Lots of great features. Steering, pumping pistions, shocks, and a whole bunch of other features. The CD-Rom is good too. A chasing game to unlock bulding instructions for the alternitive moadels. It also has a showcase of the other technic sets that were out durring the time and it shows how those sets work. Very Nice!!!!!!!!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Ace
review:
I Got This Car Ages For My B'day 1nce. I Believe It Was Discounted, But I Would Have Paid It's Full Price. The CD rom Is Very Good! The Games Are Quite Hard IMO

The set Itself Has A Lengthy Build, And Can be Compicated.

Very Good Set, And If You See 1, Pick It Up!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: A satisfying afternoon
review: This set is excellent, it has all sorts of things to keep you interested.  The suspension works very well.  One problem I had was with the buggy.  This is, in my view, the better looking model, but the 1x4 plate that keeps the bottom part of the engine fixed in is constantly being pushed off when the suspension goes down.  It was dissapointing that you have to work right the way through the game on the CD to get any of the bonus instructions.  The CD also messed up my brother's computer so I have not used it again since.  It is rather annoying to have to sit in front of the computer to make a model as the surface is usually cluttered and might become a burial ground for small pieces.  This set resists the temptation, that seems to be irresistable for LEGO in modern sets, to use loads of decoration pieces to disguise a distinct lack of substance on the model.  None of the pieces in this set are specifically meant for one purpose therefore making it acceptable for LEGO purists.  At an average pace it takes about 5 hours to make and is worth the effort.  Though there are the above complaints, the vast majority of the set's contents encourage positive feedback.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: best car set of 1998!
review: Igot this set yesterday and it is cool! The cd-rom does not work with windows XP,though. It also works like a real car with the moving engine and the working stearing wheel,plus the suspention! It also can change from off-road to street car and has other models but it is a bit expensive....

author: jim2301
title: A great looking car.
review: This set has quite a lot going for it, it may not look like much on the surface, but there is a lot going on underneath. First of all is the rear suspension which has two settings, there's the cool looking, sleek low-rider, then at the flick of a switch you get a more agressive looking street fighter. Also, the 'hand of god' steering is connected to the steering wheel in the cockpit. Add all that to a very cool, futuristic colour scheme and the lowest profile wheels I think Lego ever made and you end up with a very nice package. Yet another bonus you may be unaware of is that the car fits perfectly with set 8462, it's as if they were made for each other, fancy that!!

author: legomaniac_jacob
title: Cool futuristic car
review: My friend from school had this set when I was 9.  I first saw it when I hung out at his house over the weekend once, and I liked it so much I asked him if I could borrow it.  He did, and I basically kept it within an arms length of me 24 hours a day for a whole week.  I liked the fluidity of the vehicle, the color scheme, and how realistic the steering was.  Very nicely designed.  I recently bought it for myself from ebay, and it's still just as cool.  A great addition to any technic enthusiasts collection.
